1 #include "server_ws.hpp"
2 //#include "client_ws.hpp"
3 
4 using namespace std;
5 
6 typedef SimpleWeb::SocketServer<SimpleWeb::WS> WsServer;
7 //typedef SimpleWeb::SocketClient<SimpleWeb::WS> WsClient;
8 
9 int main() {
10  //WebSocket (WS)-server at port 8080 using 1 thread
11  WsServer server;
12  server.config.port=9090;
13 
14  //Example 1: echo WebSocket endpoint
15  // Added debug messages for example use of the callbacks
16  // Test with the following JavaScript:
17  // var ws=new WebSocket("ws://localhost:8080/echo");
18  // ws.onmessage=function(evt){console.log(evt.data);};
19  // ws.send("test");
20  auto& echo=server.endpoint["^/?$"];
21 
22  echo.on_open=[](shared_ptr<WsServer::Connection> connection) {
23  cout << "Server: Opened connection " << (size_t)connection.get() << endl;
24  };
25 
26  echo.on_message=[&server](shared_ptr<WsServer::Connection> connection, shared_ptr<WsServer::Message> message) {
27  //WsServer::Message::string() is a convenience function for:
28  //stringstream data_ss;
29  //data_ss << message->rdbuf();
30  //auto message_str = data_ss.str();
31  auto message_str=message->string();
32 
33  cout << "Server: Message received: \"" << message_str << "\" from " << (size_t)connection.get() << endl;
34 
35  auto send_stream=make_shared<WsServer::SendStream>();
36  message_str = "1";
37  *send_stream << message_str;
38  //server.send is an asynchronous function
39  server.send(connection, send_stream, [](const SimpleWeb::error_code& ec){
40  if(ec) {
41  cout << "Server: Error sending message. " <<
42  //See http://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_55_0/doc/html/boost_asio/reference.html, Error Codes for error code meanings
43  "Error: " << ec << ", error message: " << ec.message() << endl;
44  }
45  });
46 
47  cout << "Server: Sending message \"" << message_str << "\" to " << (size_t)connection.get() << endl;
48  };
49 
50  //See RFC 6455 7.4.1. for status codes
51  echo.on_close=[](shared_ptr<WsServer::Connection> connection, int status, const string& /*reason*/) {
52  cout << "Server: Closed connection " << (size_t)connection.get() << " with status code " << status << endl;
53  };
54 
55  //See http://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_55_0/doc/html/boost_asio/reference.html, Error Codes for error code meanings
56  echo.on_error=[](shared_ptr<WsServer::Connection> connection, const SimpleWeb::error_code& ec) {
57  cout << "Server: Error in connection " << (size_t)connection.get() << ". " <<
58  "Error: " << ec << ", error message: " << ec.message() << endl;
59  };
60 
61  server.start();
62 
63 
64  return 0;
65 }
